PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.OUTPUT_DEVICE_DOC: Select the Audio Output Device from the ones available in your system
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.VOLUME_NORMALIZATION_DOC: If turned On Volumio will normalize the volume of tracks as they play. This might reduce sound quality
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.AUDIO_BUFFER_SIZE_DOC: This specifies the size of the audio buffer. Increase it to avoid chances of audio stuttering over Network
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.BUFFER_BEFORE_PLAY_DOC: This specifies how much of the audio buffer should be filled before playing a track. Try increasing this if you hear skipping when manually changing songs.
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.DEFAULT_STARTUP_VOLUME_DOC: This is the default volume that is set at system startup.
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.MAX_VOLUME_LEVEL_DOC: Sets a maximum volume for the system
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.ONE_CLICK_VOLUME_STEPS_DOC: Sets the volume difference for single clicks on + and - volume buttons
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.VOLUME_CURVE_MODE_DOC: Natural (Logarithmic) is how most people is used to Volume variations, don't change it unless the volume curve is too steep in your system
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.I2S_DAC_ACTIVATED_MESSAGE: has been enabled, restart the system for changes to take effect
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.I2S_DAC_DEACTIVATED_MESSAGE: has been disabled, restart the system for changes to take effect
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.DSD_DOC: Choose the DSD Playback mode: Direct DSD Playback plays DSD Native on supported hardware, if DSD is not supported by your DAC then DSD is converted on-the-fly to PCM. With DoP (DSD over PCM), DSD streams will be encapsulated in 24 bits PCM (as per DoP Standard).
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.DSD_AUTO_VOLUME_DOC: DSD Requires volume to be set to 100, if enabled when DSD is playing Volume will be automatically set to 100 (WARNING: Set with caution!)
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.MIXER_CONTROL_NAME_DOC: Change the mixer control, useful when your Audio device has more volume controls. Default values are usually fine, change only if your volume level does not change after an action on the UI
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.MIXER_TYPE_DOC: Select the Mixer Type: None = No volume control, Software = Volume control but loss of Audio Quality, Hardware = Best of both worlds, provides ability to change volume without loss of quality
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.AUDIO_RESAMPLING_DOC: This settings controls Audio Resampling options. For local file playback only (does not apply to Shairport and Third Party services like ROON)
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.ADVANCED_DAC_DSP_OPTIONS_DOC: Those tweaks can enable particular DSP options, available only on some I2S DACs
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.DSP_PROGRAM_REBOOT: In order to activate this DSP Program, a reboot is required
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.PERSISTENT_QUEUE_DOC: If enabled the Playqueue will be retained post reboot, if disabled the play queue will be cleared at every system start
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.MPD_VOLUME_DOC: Allow MPD Clients to change Volume, this will negatively impact Volume change speed
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.RESAMPLING_ALG_DOC: This setting allows to set the ideal Resampling algorithm quality. Higher quality requires greater computing power, therefore sound might stutter or pause on low power devices. If that's the case lower the quality until you get smooth playback
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.ISO_PLAYBACK_DOC: Use an experimental MPD version which allows ISO Files playback, you will loose DSD direct capabilities when enabled
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.EXTENDED_FILE_FORMAT_SUPPORT_DOC: This settings controls the ability to read a wide variety of Audio formats, however it might slow down the creation of music library database. If disabled, the system will still read most of music formats and Music Library scanning will be much faster
PLAYBACK_OPTIONS.NO_OUTPUT_DEVICE_MESSAGE: Please connect an Audio Output Device to the Unit

NETWORK.AUTOMATIC_IP_DOC: Choose between DHCP and Static IP configuration
NETWORK.ENABLE_HOTSPOT_DOC: The system will start an enabled hotspot automatically if the wireless network is dropped or no wireless network has been configured. Disable the hotspot feature to prevent this happening.
NETWORK.HOTSPOT_PASSWORD_DOC: Change the default Hotspot Password, use a passphrase of at least 8 characters
NETWORK.HOTSPOT_CHANNEL_DOC: Change the Hotspot Transmitting channel. This might be useful to improve wireless connection trough Hotspot in network-dense environments
NETWORK.HOTSPOT_PW_LENGTH: Hotspot Password must be at least 8 characters long
NETWORK.WIRELESS_ENABLED_DOC: Enable or disable Wireless Networking, this might improve Sound quality of the system
NETWORK.STATIC_IP_WARNING: Warning, please make sure Static IP Settings are correct. A wrong configuration might render your device unreachable
NETWORK.ENABLE_CUSTOM_DNS_DOC: Set a custom DNS server, if enabled. This can be useful if your system cannot reach the internet, play webradios or download updates
NETWORK.DNS_ERROR_INFO: Please fill both DNS IP addresses properly
NETWORK.WIRELESS_NETWORK_CONNECTION_ERROR_PROCEE: Please retry or proceed to next step
NETWORK.WIRELESS_NETWORK_CONNECTION_DEFER: The unit will connect to network
NETWORK.WIRELESS_NETWORK_CONNECTION_DEFER2: when first setup will be completed
NETWORK.HOTSPOT_FALLBACK_DOC: If enabled, Hotspot will start when Wireless Network connection is lost. If disabled, the unit will keep on trying to reconnect to a known Wireless network

NETWORKFS.ALIAS_DOC: Choose an Alias that will be displayed in NAS Mounts
NETWORKFS.ERROR_PATH_UNDEFINED: Please provide Share Name or Path

COMMON.UPDATING_MUSIC_DB_WAIT_MESSAGE: Your music is being scanned and the icon on bottom left will keep spinning until all your library has been successfully indexed. Since the system might be less responsive during this operation, please don't use the system while music is being indexed

APPEARANCE.UI_CONFIG_SELECT_LANGUAGE_DOC: Select the Language of your system
APPEARANCE.WEB_ALBUMART_ENABLE_DOC: Enable retrieval of Album art from Web, if no image is found in the file folder
APPEARANCE.WEB_ALBUMART_SIZE_DOC: Choose the size of Album art downloaded from web: higher quality requires longer load times. Lower values may improve load times.
APPEARANCE.SHOW_TRACKNUMBERS_DOC: Prepend track numbers to tracks title
APPEARANCE.ARTIST_SORTING_DOC: Choose the metadata used to sort artists
APPEARANCE.COMPILATION_METADATA_DOC: Configure the metadata fields used to describe albumartist in compilations or 'multiple artist' albums, use comma separated fields
APPEARANCE.ALBUMART_CACHE_CLEAR_ERROR: Error claring albumart cache, please retry in few minutes
APPEARANCE.ALBUMART_RESET_CACHE_DOC: The system caches your albumart to improve performance, but this prevents newly added albumart from being shown. By resetting the cache you will be able to see newly added albumart
APPEARANCE.METADATA_IMAGE_DOC: When enabled, if no albumart file can be found in the folder, the system will attempt to extract any albumart embedded in your music files. This will most likely increase albumart loading times

ALARM.TIME_SELECT_ERROR: Please select an alarm start time

SYSTEM.PLAYER_NAME_DOC: This is the name of your system as it will appear on your network
SYSTEM.STARTUP_SOUND_DOC: Enable or disable the Startup Sound, which notifies that the system has successfully started and it's ready to play
SYSTEM.CHECK_UPDATES_DESCR: Check if newer versions of the system are available
SYSTEM.DELETE_USER_DATA_DESCR: Delete all your settings and data
SYSTEM.DELETE_USER_DATA_MESSAGE: This will delete all your personal settings, favorites and playlists (USB and NAS music won't be deleted). The system will automatically restart once data has been deleted. Do you want to continue?
SYSTEM.FACTORY_RESET_DESCR: Reset your System to factory Settings
SYSTEM.FACTORY_RESET_MESSAGE: This will reset your device to factory settings, all your settings will be lost. The system will automatically restart once reset. Do you want to continue?
SYSTEM.UPDATE_ALREADY_LATEST_VERSION: You're already on the latest version
SYSTEM.INSTALLING_TO_DISK_ERROR_TARGET_SIZE: Cannot install on this Disk: destination Disk must be bigger than source disk
SYSTEM.INSTALL_TO_DISK_MESSAGE: Confirm you want to Install Volumio on Disk
SYSTEM.INSTALL_TO_DISK_MESSAGE_WARNING: . WARNING: Be careful to select the correct destination disk, as all data on it will be deleted!
SYSTEM.INSTALLING_TO_DISK_SUCCESS_MESSAGE: In order to use your newly installed system, restart the system and remove any removable media
SYSTEM.HDMI_UI_DOC: Show User Interface via HDMI Video Output. WARNING: This will degrade system performances
SYSTEM.SYSTEM_INTEGRITY_CHECK_FAILED: System Software Integrity check failed, manually edited files were detected. System Software Update is not possible under those circumstances. Please execute a Factory Reset or Delete User Data, then retry.

PLUGINS.CONFIRM_PLUGIN_UNINSTALL_MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to uninstall this Plugin
PLUGINS.PLUGIN_START_ERROR: This plugin is failing to start. Please install updated version, or contact plugin developer
PLUGINS.CONFIRM_PLUGIN_INSTALL_WARNING_MESSAGE: Warning, community plugins are developed by third parties developer and might result in unexpected behaviours and system instabilitiy. Are you sure you want to install this plugin

WIZARD.DEVICE_SUCCESSFULLY_CONFIGURED: has been configured and it's ready to play
WIZARD.PLEASE_DONATE: If you like Volumio please consider donating. You can make the difference for this project!

UPDATER.ERROR_UPDATE_FAILED: Error: update failed, please restart system and retry
